channel.title: Allstar source - OBJECT Appearance - 317
channel.description: i would need to have like a [u]ring that makes a object visible[/u] after wielding it. and invisible when not wearing. is that possible? if so plz Reply. :)

item.title: Allstar source - OBJECT Appearance - 317
item.dc:creator: @Ddragonimp Ddragonimp
item.description:
@Ddragonimp wrote:

yes…
Code i give you is delta related … so convert it.
Although not ideal for hidden doors or anything as such.

but i like your idea

public void NewObjects(){
               		if (playerEquipment[playerRing] == 3) {
				mGO(3263, 3231, 2, 1, 10); 
 			} else {
 				deletethatobject(3081, 3510);
 			}
		mGO(2722, 9911, 9910, -2, 10);
		mGO(2670, 3726, 2480, -2, 10);	
           	mGO(3107, 3496, 2486, -2, 10);
                mGO(2717, 9904, 2325, -2, 10);
		mGO(2718, 9887, 2672, -2, 10);
		mGO(2723, 9889, 2672, -1, 10);
		mGO(2715, 9904, 153, -2, 10);
		mGO(2096, 4433, 7306, 0, 10);
		mGO(2101, 4433, 7306, 0, 10);
		mGO(2090, 4433, 7306, 0, 10);
	public boolean wear(int wearID, int slot) {
		if (wearID == ) {
			NewObjects();
		}
	public void remove(int wearID, int slot) {
		if (wearID == ) {
			NewObjects();
		}
public void mGO(int x, int y, int typeID, int orientation, int tileObjectType){ //Makes Global objects
		for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players){
			if(p != null){
				client person = (client)p;
				if((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != "null")){
					if(person.distanceToPoint(x, y) <= 60){
						person.createNewTileObject(x, y, typeID, orientation, tileObjectType);
					}
				}
			}
		}
	}
public void deletethatobject(int objectX, int objectY) { 
	ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, 6951, -1, 10);
	}
